document.docTitle: Osbornellus sineprocessus Dominguez & Godoy 2010, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic review of the genus Osbornellus Ball (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae) in Central America 2702

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic review of the genus Osbornellus Ball (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae) in Central America 2702

heading.emphasis:
Osbornellus sineprocessus Domínguez & Godoy
, sp. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Description. Length: 4.8–6.1 mm . Member of the
O. auronitens
group ( Fig.1a ). General description as in
O. eberhardi
.

Diagnosis. Very similar to
O. anonae
in external appearance, but the aedeagus of
O. sineprocessus
lacks ventral processes, whereas in
O. anonae
the ventral processes are present.
Distribution. Known only from Costa Rica ; 300–1100 m .
Etymology. This species is named for the absence of ventral processes on the aedeagus.

Type material:
Holotype , male, COSTA RICA : Guanacaste , 3
Km SE Río Naranjo
, Rancho Montezuma ,
4-II-1995
. R. G. Allen ( INBio )
.
